intro: Adinandra ryukyuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu adenium, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal or limestone-rich soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
